description: Data storage architecture design involves creating a framework for how data is stored, accessed, and managed in software applications. It is crucial for ensuring that applications can scale efficiently and meet diverse data management needs.
you_have_this_if: You are experiencing performance bottlenecks in your current data storage solution.
Your application is expected to scale significantly in the near future.
You have diverse data types that require different storage solutions.
You are transitioning from a monolithic architecture to a more modular approach.
You need to optimize data retrieval times for a web application.

approaches.best_for: When building a web application that requires high scalability and diverse data management needs.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Offers flexibility in data management but may introduce complexity in integration.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to support a variety of data types and anticipate high traffic loads.

start_here: The recommended first approach for most cases is the Hybrid Data Storage Architecture, as it provides the flexibility needed for diverse data types while supporting scalability.
